document.masterDocTitle: Two new and one newly recorded species of Anomala Samouelle, 1819 (Coleoptera Scarabaeidae: Rutelinae) from Yunnan, China

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: Two new and one newly recorded species of Anomala Samouelle, 1819 (Coleoptera Scarabaeidae: Rutelinae) from Yunnan, China

bibRefCitation.author: Arrow, G. J.
bibRefCitation.refString: Arrow, G. J. (1917) The fauna of British India, including Ceylon and Burma. Coleoptera Lamellicornia part II (Rutelinae, Desmonycinae, and Euchirinae). Taylor & Francis, London, 387 pp.

4♂♂ and 10♀♀ ( CFLW ): Hulukou , Xima , Yingjiang County , Dehong , 98°65’61.97” E , 24°32’06.63” N , VI–VII .2018, alt.
1700 m
, Wei-Zong Yang leg.

Intraspecific variation. Specimens of
A. trochanterica
from Yunnan ( Figs. 6, 7 , 14, 19, 24 ), Sichuan ( Figs. 8 , 12, 17, 22 ) and Xizang ( Figs. 9 , 13, 18, 23 ) show different luster of dorsal part of the body and different depth of elytral striae. Additionally, parameres of male genitalia show different shapes in profile: basal process of parameres sub-triangular at apical half in the specimens from Sichuan ( Fig. 22 ) and Xizang ( Fig. 23 ), rounded in the speci- mens from Yunnan ( Fig. 24 ); apex of parameres in the specimens from Sichuan ( Fig. 22 ) wider than the specimens from Xizang ( Fig. 23 ) and Yunnan ( Fig. 24 ), but apex of parameres in the specimens from Xizang ( Fig. 23 ) more processed towards dorsum than the specimens from Yunnan ( Fig. 24 ).
Distribution. China ( new country record ): Yunnan , Xizang , Sichuan ; India ; Bhutan ; Nepal .
Remarks. This species was known from Bhutan , India ( Sikkim ) and Nepal ( Arrow 1917 ; Zorn & Bezděk 2016 ), and is here newly recorded from China .
